metadata.Title: CVE-2021-33655 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
When sending malicous data to kernel by ioctl cmdFBIOPUT_VSCREENINFO,kernel will write memory out of bounds.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33655` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-193-generic - 4.15.0-193.204
linux-image-4.15.0-193-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-193.204
linux-image-4.15.0-193-lowlatency - 4.15.0-193.204
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-193-generic - 4.15.0-193.204
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-193-lowlatency - 4.15.0-193.204
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-126-generic - 5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-126-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1

No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1127-kvm - 4.15.0-1127.132
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-193.204').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1').
